info.title: Regrid OpenAPI Specification
info.description: Integrate Regrid's parcel data in your tech stack with over 156M parcels records with associated spatial and tabular data including over 120 fields.

externalDocs.description: Regrid Parcel documentation and extended examples

get.description: This endpoint delivers parcels using latitude and longitude points. You can add a radius zone to the point or points and limit the amount of parcels returned in the response. Parameter 'geojson' takes priority if Lat/Lon is used in same request. This endpoint allows access to test all of our premium matched datasets. **Attention API Trial Token Users:** Data is restricted to 7 counties. Please only use data from one of the restricted counties.

parameters.name: lon
parameters.description: Longitude point

parameters.name: lat
parameters.description: Latitude point

parameters.name: radius
parameters.description: (Default: 0, Maximum: 32000) Radius in meters for which all Parcel records will be returned if they are within the radius zone from latitude and longitude point.

parameters.name: geojson
parameters.description: Geographic data structure for Point and MultiPoint only. This parameter takes priority if Lat/Lon is used in same request

parameters.name: offset_id
parameters.description: ID from a previous query exceeding the limit, returns the next set of results up to limit.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of Parcel Records to return.

parameters.name: return_count
parameters.description: Set to true to enable count of parcels in query.

parameters.name: return_geometry
parameters.description: Default true. A features are returned without geometry values.

parameters.name: return_custom
parameters.description: Default false: A true value allows county-specific fields to be passed through beyond standard schema fields only.

parameters.name: return_field_labels
parameters.description: Default false: A true value shows the naming convention for each standardized schema field.

parameters.name: return_stacked
parameters.description: Default true: A false value returns the first parcel if geometries are identical.

parameters.name: return_zoning
parameters.description: Set to false to disable zoning data in the response. Default is true when supported by the account.

parameters.name: return_matched_buildings
parameters.description: Set to false to disable building footprint data in the response. Default is true when supported by the account.

parameters.name: return_matched_addresses
parameters.description: Set to false to matched addresses data in the response. Default is true when supported by the account.

parameters.name: return_enhanced_ownership
parameters.description: Set to false to disable enhanced ownership data in the response. Default is true when supported by the account.

200.description: A list of parcel features. When supported by the account with buildings array and addresses property

allOf.description: Abstract type for all GeoJSon 'Geometry' object the type of which is not 'GeometryCollection'
Abstract type for all GeoJSon object except Feature and FeatureCollection

GeoJSon object
The coordinate reference system for all GeoJSON coordinates is a geographic coordinate reference system, using the World Geodetic System 1984 (WGS 84) datum, with longitude and latitude units of decimal degrees. This is equivalent to the coordinate reference system identified by the Open Geospatial Consortium (OGC) URN An OPTIONAL third-position element SHALL be the height in meters above or below the WGS 84 reference ellipsoid. In the absence of elevation values, applications sensitive to height or depth SHOULD interpret positions as being at local ground or sea level.

items.description:
A linear ring is a closed LineString with four or more positions.
The first and last positions are equivalent, and they MUST contain identical values; their representation SHOULD also be identical.
A linear ring is the boundary of a surface or the boundary of a hole in a surface.
A linear ring MUST follow the right-hand rule with respect to the area it bounds, i.e., exterior rings are counterclockwise, and holes are clockwise.

GeoJSon fundamental geometry construct.
A position is an array of numbers. There MUST be two or more elements. The first two elements are longitude and latitude, or easting and northing, precisely in that order and using decimal numbers. Altitude or elevation MAY be included as an optional third element.
Implementations SHOULD NOT extend positions beyond three elements because the semantics of extra elements are unspecified and ambiguous. Historically, some implementations have used a fourth element to carry a linear referencing measure (sometimes denoted as "M") or a numerical timestamp, but in most situations a parser will not be able to properly interpret these values. The interpretation and meaning of additional elements is beyond the scope of this specification, and additional elements MAY be ignored by parsers.

headline.description: A human-friendly display address for the parcel. If no address is available, it falls back to the parcel number.

fields.description: Standard Schema keys and values. Columns from the parcel table. These include standard column names wherever fields are available, plus additional columns varying by the particular county & data available.

field_labels.description: Human-friendly labels for each key in fields

context.description: A bit of info about the city or county where this parcel is found, including a path one can use as context for further searches.

addresses.description: Regrid Matched Addresses. This array is included in responses when an account has Matched Addresses enabled.

buildings.description: Matched buildings are returned when supported by an account.

ed_str_uuid.description: Universally Unique ID of the entire structure

ed_bld_uuid.description: Universal Unique ID of the building extracted from the structure

ed_lat.description: Latitude of a point in the shape, typically the centroid

ed_lon.description: Longitude of a point in the shape, typically the centroid

ed_bldg_footprint_sqft.description: Building footprint area in square feet

ed_largest.description: An indicator of the largest building on a parcel

ed_source_date.description: Date of the building source imagery formatted as MM/DD/YYYY

ed_mean_height.description: Mean height of the structure in feet. Available with Matched Building Footprints with Height Addon.

ed_max_object_height.description: Maximum height of the structure in ft, excluding potential clutter like an antenna, overhanging tree, etc.. Available with Matched Building Footprints with Height Addon.

ed_lag.description: Lowest Adjacent Grade - lowest observed ground elevation above sea level around the boundary of the building. Available with Matched Building Footprints with Height Addon.

ed_hag.description: Highest Adjacent Grade - highest observed ground elevation above sea level around the boundary of the building. Available with Matched Building Footprints with Height Addon.

ed_mean_elevation.description: Mean ground elevation in ft under the structure footprint. Available with Matched Building Footprints with Height Addon.

ed_mean_slope.description: Mean roof slope. Available with Matched Building Footprints with Height Addon.

ed_stories.description: Estimated number of stories based on building height. Available with Matched Building Footprints with Height Addon.

ed_gross_area.description: Estimated area of the building based on stories and square footage of the polygon. Available with Matched Building Footprints with Height Addon.

ed_volume.description: Volume of the building based on square footage and the mean height of the polygon in cubic feet. Available with Matched Building Footprints with Height Addon.

zoning.description: Zoning details are returned when supported by an account.

get.description: This endpoint delivers parcels using an address within the United States and Puerto Rico. There can be multiple locations within the United States and Puerto Rico with similar addresses and therefore we suggest specifying the location within a State, County and/or City by using the `path` parameter.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: A street address or partial address, starting at the beginning

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: Represents the path for the /country/state/county. This restricts the search to this area.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of Parcel Records to return.

parameters.name: return_custom
parameters.description: Default false: A true value allows county-specific fields to be passed through beyond standard schema fields only.

parameters.name: return_field_labels
parameters.description: Default false: A true value shows the naming convention for each standardized schema field.

parameters.name: return_stacked
parameters.description: Default true: A false value returns the first parcel if geometries are identical.

parameters.name: return_zoning
parameters.description: Set to false to disable zoning data in the response. Default is true when supported by the account.

parameters.name: return_matched_buildings
parameters.description: Set to false to disable building footprint data in the response. Default is true when supported by the account.

parameters.name: return_matched_addresses
parameters.description: Set to false to matched addresses data in the response. Default is true when supported by the account.

parameters.name: return_enhanced_ownership
parameters.description: Set to false to disable enhanced ownership data in the response. Default is true when supported by the account.

200.description: A list of parcel features. When supported by the account with buildings array and addresses property

allOf.description: Abstract type for all GeoJSon 'Geometry' object the type of which is not 'GeometryCollection'
Abstract type for all GeoJSon object except Feature and FeatureCollection

GeoJSon object
The coordinate reference system for all GeoJSON coordinates is a geographic coordinate reference system, using the World Geodetic System 1984 (WGS 84) datum, with longitude and latitude units of decimal degrees. This is equivalent to the coordinate reference system identified by the Open Geospatial Consortium (OGC) URN An OPTIONAL third-position element SHALL be the height in meters above or below the WGS 84 reference ellipsoid. In the absence of elevation values, applications sensitive to height or depth SHOULD interpret positions as being at local ground or sea level.

items.description:
A linear ring is a closed LineString with four or more positions.
The first and last positions are equivalent, and they MUST contain identical values; their representation SHOULD also be identical.
A linear ring is the boundary of a surface or the boundary of a hole in a surface.
A linear ring MUST follow the right-hand rule with respect to the area it bounds, i.e., exterior rings are counterclockwise, and holes are clockwise.

GeoJSon fundamental geometry construct.
A position is an array of numbers. There MUST be two or more elements. The first two elements are longitude and latitude, or easting and northing, precisely in that order and using decimal numbers. Altitude or elevation MAY be included as an optional third element.
Implementations SHOULD NOT extend positions beyond three elements because the semantics of extra elements are unspecified and ambiguous. Historically, some implementations have used a fourth element to carry a linear referencing measure (sometimes denoted as "M") or a numerical timestamp, but in most situations a parser will not be able to properly interpret these values. The interpretation and meaning of additional elements is beyond the scope of this specification, and additional elements MAY be ignored by parsers.

headline.description: A human-friendly display address for the parcel. If no address is available, it falls back to the parcel number.

fields.description: Standard Schema keys and values. Columns from the parcel table. These include standard column names wherever fields are available, plus additional columns varying by the particular county & data available.

field_labels.description: Human-friendly labels for each key in fields

context.description: A bit of info about the city or county where this parcel is found, including a path one can use as context for further searches.

addresses.description: Regrid Matched Addresses. This array is included in responses when an account has Matched Addresses enabled.

buildings.description: Matched buildings are returned when supported by an account.

ed_str_uuid.description: Universally Unique ID of the entire structure

ed_bld_uuid.description: Universal Unique ID of the building extracted from the structure

ed_lat.description: Latitude of a point in the shape, typically the centroid

ed_lon.description: Longitude of a point in the shape, typically the centroid

ed_bldg_footprint_sqft.description: Building footprint area in square feet

ed_largest.description: An indicator of the largest building on a parcel

ed_source_date.description: Date of the building source imagery formatted as MM/DD/YYYY

ed_mean_height.description: Mean height of the structure in feet. Available with Matched Building Footprints with Height Addon.

ed_max_object_height.description: Maximum height of the structure in ft, excluding potential clutter like an antenna, overhanging tree, etc.. Available with Matched Building Footprints with Height Addon.

ed_lag.description: Lowest Adjacent Grade - lowest observed ground elevation above sea level around the boundary of the building. Available with Matched Building Footprints with Height Addon.

ed_hag.description: Highest Adjacent Grade - highest observed ground elevation above sea level around the boundary of the building. Available with Matched Building Footprints with Height Addon.

ed_mean_elevation.description: Mean ground elevation in ft under the structure footprint. Available with Matched Building Footprints with Height Addon.

ed_mean_slope.description: Mean roof slope. Available with Matched Building Footprints with Height Addon.

ed_stories.description: Estimated number of stories based on building height. Available with Matched Building Footprints with Height Addon.

ed_gross_area.description: Estimated area of the building based on stories and square footage of the polygon. Available with Matched Building Footprints with Height Addon.

ed_volume.description: Volume of the building based on square footage and the mean height of the polygon in cubic feet. Available with Matched Building Footprints with Height Addon.

zoning.description: Zoning details are returned when supported by an account.

get.description: This endpoint delivers parcels using the Assessor Parcel Number (APN) which is assigned to each parcel by the respective county. Multiple parcels can be returned depending on the APN, therefore specify the location within a State, County and/or City by using the parameter `path`. **Attention API Trial Token Users:** Data is restricted to 7 counties. Please only use data from one of the restricted counties.

schema.description: The assessor's parcel number to look up. Non-alphanumeric characters will be removed when searching.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: Represents the path for the /country/state/county. This restricts the search to this area.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of Parcel Records to return.

parameters.name: return_custom
parameters.description: Default false: A true value allows county-specific fields to be passed through beyond standard schema fields only.

parameters.name: return_field_labels
parameters.description: Default false: A true value shows the naming convention for each standardized schema field.

parameters.name: return_stacked
parameters.description: Default true: A false value returns the first parcel if geometries are identical.

parameters.name: return_zoning
parameters.description: Set to false to disable zoning data in the response. Default is true when supported by the account.

parameters.name: return_matched_buildings
parameters.description: Set to false to disable building footprint data in the response. Default is true when supported by the account.

parameters.name: return_matched_addresses
parameters.description: Set to false to matched addresses data in the response. Default is true when supported by the account.

parameters.name: return_enhanced_ownership
parameters.description: Set to false to disable enhanced ownership data in the response. Default is true when supported by the account.

200.description: A list of parcel features. When supported by the account with buildings array and addresses property

get.description: This endpoint delivers parcels using the owner name, either an individual or entity. Multiple parcels can be returned so limit  the response by using parameter `limit` and specify the location within a State, County and/or City using the parameter `path`.  This endpoint allows access to test all of our premium matched datasets.

parameters.name: owner
parameters.description: The owner name in Last, First format. Matches by prefix, you can pass just a last name to get any name beginning with that string.  (Case insensitive, minimum 4 characters)

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: Represents the path for the /country/state/county. This restricts the search to this area.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of Parcel Records to return.

parameters.name: return_custom
parameters.description: Default false: A true value allows county-specific fields to be passed through beyond standard schema fields only.

parameters.name: return_field_labels
parameters.description: Default false: A true value shows the naming convention for each standardized schema field.

parameters.name: return_stacked
parameters.description: Default true: A false value returns the first parcel if geometries are identical.

parameters.name: return_zoning
parameters.description: Set to false to disable zoning data in the response. Default is true when supported by the account.

parameters.name: return_matched_buildings
parameters.description: Set to false to disable building footprint data in the response. Default is true when supported by the account.

parameters.name: return_matched_addresses
parameters.description: Set to false to matched addresses data in the response. Default is true when supported by the account.

parameters.name: return_enhanced_ownership
parameters.description: Set to false to disable enhanced ownership data in the response. Default is true when supported by the account.

200.description: A list of parcel features. When supported by the account with buildings array and addresses property

In the absence of elevation values, applications sensitive to height or depth SHOULD interpret positions as being at local ground or sea level.

items.description:
A linear ring is a closed LineString with four or more positions.
The first and last positions are equivalent, and they MUST contain identical values; their representation SHOULD also be identical.
A linear ring is the boundary of a surface or the boundary of a hole in a surface.
A linear ring MUST follow the right-hand rule with respect to the area it bounds, i.e., exterior rings are counterclockwise, and holes are clockwise.

GeoJSon fundamental geometry construct.
A position is an array of numbers. There MUST be two or more elements. The first two elements are longitude and latitude, or easting and northing, precisely in that order and using decimal numbers. Altitude or elevation MAY be included as an optional third element.
Implementations SHOULD NOT extend positions beyond three elements because the semantics of extra elements are unspecified and ambiguous. Historically, some implementations have used a fourth element to carry a linear referencing measure (sometimes denoted as "M") or a numerical timestamp, but in most situations a parser will not be able to properly interpret these values. The interpretation and meaning of additional elements is beyond the scope of this specification, and additional elements MAY be ignored by parsers.

headline.description: A human-friendly display address for the parcel. If no address is available, it falls back to the parcel number.

fields.description: Standard Schema keys and values. Columns from the parcel table. These include standard column names wherever fields are available, plus additional columns varying by the particular county & data available.

field_labels.description: Human-friendly labels for each key in fields

context.description: A bit of info about the city or county where this parcel is found, including a path one can use as context for further searches.

addresses.description: Regrid Matched Addresses. This array is included in responses when an account has Matched Addresses enabled.

buildings.description: Matched buildings are returned when supported by an account.

ed_str_uuid.description: Universally Unique ID of the entire structure

ed_bld_uuid.description: Universal Unique ID of the building extracted from the structure

ed_lat.description: Latitude of a point in the shape, typically the centroid

ed_lon.description: Longitude of a point in the shape, typically the centroid

ed_bldg_footprint_sqft.description: Building footprint area in square feet

ed_largest.description: An indicator of the largest building on a parcel

ed_source_date.description: Date of the building source imagery formatted as MM/DD/YYYY

ed_mean_height.description: Mean height of the structure in feet. Available with Matched Building Footprints with Height Addon.

ed_max_object_height.description: Maximum height of the structure in ft, excluding potential clutter like an antenna, overhanging tree, etc.. Available with Matched Building Footprints with Height Addon.

ed_lag.description: Lowest Adjacent Grade - lowest observed ground elevation above sea level around the boundary of the building. Available with Matched Building Footprints with Height Addon.

ed_hag.description: Highest Adjacent Grade - highest observed ground elevation above sea level around the boundary of the building. Available with Matched Building Footprints with Height Addon.

ed_mean_elevation.description: Mean ground elevation in ft under the structure footprint. Available with Matched Building Footprints with Height Addon.

ed_mean_slope.description: Mean roof slope. Available with Matched Building Footprints with Height Addon.

ed_stories.description: Estimated number of stories based on building height. Available with Matched Building Footprints with Height Addon.

ed_gross_area.description: Estimated area of the building based on stories and square footage of the polygon. Available with Matched Building Footprints with Height Addon.

ed_volume.description: Volume of the building based on square footage and the mean height of the polygon in cubic feet. Available with Matched Building Footprints with Height Addon.

zoning.description: Zoning details are returned when supported by an account.

get.description: In addition to the primary identifiers in our dataset, our API is also queryable at a nationwide level using a subset of our 120+ schema fields that have been optimized for queries at scale. The following is the general form for this endpoint. See additional query endpoints for examples on each field type. Multiple fields can be used in a single query (up to 4), to refine results. [See full list of fields](https://support.regrid.com/articles/using-the-api/#query-by-additional-parcel-data-fields). See full list of fields. Check out Sample Use Case Scenarios in this section. This endpoint allows access to test all of our premium matched datasets.

parameters.name: fields[:field_name][:operator]
parameters.description: Use a supported field name and operator, and value to perform a query.

parameters.name: offset_id
parameters.description: ID from a previous query exceeding the limit, returns the next set of results up to limit.

parameters.name: geojson
parameters.description: A GeoJSON object with at least one geometry to filter results. The geometries can be no larger than 80 sq miles. If both `geojson` and `lat`-`lon` are present, `geojson` takes precedence. Accepted GeoJSON formats are: FeatureCollection, Feature or geometry. Supported geometries: Polygon, MultiPolygon, Point, MultiPoint, LineString and MultiLineString. Variations of geometry types are allowed in a FeatureCollection.

parameters.name: radius
parameters.description: (Default: 0, Maximum: 32000) Radius in meters for which all Parcel records will be returned if they are within the radius zone from latitude and longitude point.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of Parcel Records to return.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: Represents the path for the /country/state/county. This restricts the search to this area.

parameters.name: return_count
parameters.description: Set to true to enable count of parcels in query.

parameters.name: return_geometry
parameters.description: Default true. A features are returned without geometry values.

parameters.name: return_custom
parameters.description: Default false: A true value allows county-specific fields to be passed through beyond standard schema fields only.

parameters.name: return_field_labels
parameters.description: Default false: A true value shows the naming convention for each standardized schema field.

parameters.name: return_stacked
parameters.description: Default true: A false value returns the first parcel if geometries are identical.

parameters.name: return_zoning
parameters.description: Set to false to disable zoning data in the response. Default is true when supported by the account.

parameters.name: return_matched_buildings
parameters.description: Set to false to disable building footprint data in the response. Default is true when supported by the account.

parameters.name: return_matched_addresses
parameters.description: Set to false to matched addresses data in the response. Default is true when supported by the account.

parameters.name: return_enhanced_ownership
parameters.description: Set to false to disable enhanced ownership data in the response. Default is true when supported by the account.

200.description: A list of parcel features. When supported by the account with buildings array and addresses property

get.description:
Find all parcels owned by 7-Eleven in Dallas County, Texas. Limit your result with the `limit` parameter.
 Dallas County has additional fields from the county that we provide users, set `return_custom` to true to view all
 fields. **Attention API Trial Token Users:** Data is restricted to 7 counties. Please only use data from one of the restricted counties.

ed_stories.description: Estimated number of stories based on building height. Available with Matched Building Footprints with Height Addon.

get.summary: Sample Use Case - Zip Code, Land Use Code and State
get.description: Find businesses in Downtown Indianapolis within a specific zip code. These are parcels marked as Shopping, business, or trade activities. Limit your result with the `limit` parameter **Attention API Trial Token Users:** Data is restricted to 7 counties. Please only use data from one of the restricted counties.

parameters.name: fields[szip][eq]
parameters.description: Using the parcel situs zip code to search.

parameters.name: fields[lbcs_activity][between]
parameters.description: You can look up all of our land base use codes [here](https://support.regrid.com/parcel-data/lbcs-keys).

parameters.name: fields[state2][eq]
parameters.description: Using the parcel situs state to search.

parameters.name: offset_id
parameters.description: ID from a previous query exceeding the limit, returns the next set of results up to limit.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of Parcel Records to return.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: Represents the path for the /country/state/county. This restricts the search to this area.

parameters.name: return_count
parameters.description: Set to true to enable count of parcels in query.

parameters.name: return_geometry
parameters.description: Default true. A features are returned without geometry values.

parameters.name: return_custom
parameters.description: Default false: A true value allows county-specific fields to be passed through beyond standard schema fields only.

parameters.name: return_field_labels
parameters.description: Default false: A true value shows the naming convention for each standardized schema field.

parameters.name: return_stacked
parameters.description: Default true: A false value returns the first parcel if geometries are identical.

parameters.name: return_zoning
parameters.description: Set to false to disable zoning data in the response. Default is true when supported by the account.

parameters.name: return_matched_buildings
parameters.description: Set to false to disable building footprint data in the response. Default is true when supported by the account.

parameters.name: return_matched_addresses
parameters.description: Set to false to matched addresses data in the response. Default is true when supported by the account.

parameters.name: return_enhanced_ownership
parameters.description: Set to false to disable enhanced ownership data in the response. Default is true when supported by the account.

200.description: A list of parcel features. When supported by the account with buildings array and addresses property

context.description: A bit of info about the city or county where this parcel is found, including a path one can use as context for further searches.

addresses.description: Regrid Matched Addresses. This array is included in responses when an account has Matched Addresses enabled.

buildings.description: Matched buildings are returned when supported by an account.

allOf.description: Abstract type for all GeoJSon 'Geometry' object the type of which is not 'GeometryCollection'
Abstract type for all GeoJSon object except Feature and FeatureCollection

GeoJSon object
The coordinate reference system for all GeoJSON coordinates is a geographic coordinate reference system, using the World Geodetic System 1984 (WGS 84) datum, with longitude and latitude units of decimal degrees. This is equivalent to the coordinate reference system identified by the Open Geospatial Consortium (OGC) URN An OPTIONAL third-position element SHALL be the height in meters above or below the WGS 84 reference ellipsoid. In the absence of elevation values, applications sensitive to height or depth SHOULD interpret positions as being at local ground or sea level.

items.description:
A linear ring is a closed LineString with four or more positions.
The first and last positions are equivalent, and they MUST contain identical values; their representation SHOULD also be identical.
A linear ring is the boundary of a surface or the boundary of a hole in a surface.
A linear ring MUST follow the right-hand rule with respect to the area it bounds, i.e., exterior rings are counterclockwise, and holes are clockwise.

GeoJSon fundamental geometry construct.
A position is an array of numbers. There MUST be two or more elements. The first two elements are longitude and latitude, or easting and northing, precisely in that order and using decimal numbers. Altitude or elevation MAY be included as an optional third element.
Implementations SHOULD NOT extend positions beyond three elements because the semantics of extra elements are unspecified and ambiguous. Historically, some implementations have used a fourth element to carry a linear referencing measure (sometimes denoted as "M") or a numerical timestamp, but in most situations a parser will not be able to properly interpret these values. The interpretation and meaning of additional elements is beyond the scope of this specification, and additional elements MAY be ignored by parsers.

ed_str_uuid.description: Universally Unique ID of the entire structure

ed_bld_uuid.description: Universal Unique ID of the building extracted from the structure

ed_lat.description: Latitude of a point in the shape, typically the centroid

ed_lon.description: Longitude of a point in the shape, typically the centroid

ed_bldg_footprint_sqft.description: Building footprint area in square feet

ed_largest.description: An indicator of the largest building on a parcel

ed_source_date.description: Date of the building source imagery formatted as MM/DD/YYYY

ed_mean_height.description: Mean height of the structure in feet. Available with Matched Building Footprints with Height Addon.

ed_max_object_height.description: Maximum height of the structure in ft, excluding potential clutter like an antenna, overhanging tree, etc.. Available with Matched Building Footprints with Height Addon.

ed_lag.description: Lowest Adjacent Grade - lowest observed ground elevation above sea level around the boundary of the building. Available with Matched Building Footprints with Height Addon.

ed_hag.description: Highest Adjacent Grade - highest observed ground elevation above sea level around the boundary of the building. Available with Matched Building Footprints with Height Addon.

ed_mean_elevation.description: Mean ground elevation in ft under the structure footprint. Available with Matched Building Footprints with Height Addon.

ed_mean_slope.description: Mean roof slope. Available with Matched Building Footprints with Height Addon.

ed_stories.description: Estimated number of stories based on building height. Available with Matched Building Footprints with Height Addon.

ed_gross_area.description: Estimated area of the building based on stories and square footage of the polygon. Available with Matched Building Footprints with Height Addon.

ed_volume.description: Volume of the building based on square footage and the mean height of the polygon in cubic feet. Available with Matched Building Footprints with Height Addon.

zoning.description: Zoning details are returned when supported by an account.

get.summary: Sample Use Case - Polygon Area, Land Use Code and Land Value
get.description: Locate all the residential properties in a polygon area where the land value is greater or equal to $100,000.  **Attention API Trial Token Users:** Data is restricted to 7 counties. Please only use data from one of the  restricted counties.

parameters.name: geojson
parameters.description: Geographic data structure for Polygon. Can use Point and Multipoint in combination with radius in a separate request.

parameters.name: fields[lbcs_activity][eq]
parameters.description: You can look up all of our land base use codes [here](https://support.regrid.com/parcel-data/lbcs-keys).

parameters.name: fields[landval][gte]
parameters.description: Using parcel land value field.

parameters.name: offset_id
parameters.description: ID from a previous query exceeding the limit, returns the next set of results up to limit.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of Parcel Records to return.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: Represents the path for the /country/state/county. This restricts the search to this area.

parameters.name: return_count
parameters.description: Set to true to enable count of parcels in query.

parameters.name: return_geometry
parameters.description: Default true. A features are returned without geometry values.

parameters.name: return_custom
parameters.description: Default false: A true value allows county-specific fields to be passed through beyond standard schema fields only.

parameters.name: return_field_labels
parameters.description: Default false: A true value shows the naming convention for each standardized schema field.

parameters.name: return_stacked
parameters.description: Default true: A false value returns the first parcel if geometries are identical.

parameters.name: return_zoning
parameters.description: Set to false to disable zoning data in the response. Default is true when supported by the account.

parameters.name: return_matched_buildings
parameters.description: Set to false to disable building footprint data in the response. Default is true when supported by the account.

parameters.name: return_matched_addresses
parameters.description: Set to false to matched addresses data in the response. Default is true when supported by the account.

parameters.name: return_enhanced_ownership
parameters.description: Set to false to disable enhanced ownership data in the response. Default is true when supported by the account.

200.description: A list of parcel features. When supported by the account with buildings array and addresses property

get.description: Search for parcels in a specific geographical area. This endpoint allows access to test all our premium matched datasets with applicable API token. Accepted formats vary from GeoJSON Feature Collection of geometries (Polygon, MultiPolygon, Point, MultiPoint, LineString and/or MultiLineString), or a Feature with a GeoJSON geometry or a direct GeoJSON geometry. Parameter 'geojson' takes priority if Lat/Long used in same request. These parameters also accept an optional radius parameter in meters to create a buffer around the given geometries. Note adding a radius can increase the overall area of the request reaching the area size limit per request.

parameters.name: geojson
parameters.description: A GeoJSON object with at least one geometry to filter results. The geometries can be no larger than 80 sq miles. Accepted GeoJSON formats are: FeatureCollection, Feature or geometry. Supported geometries: Polygon, MultiPolygon, Point, MultiPoint, LineString and MultiLineString. Variations of geometry types are allowed in a FeatureCollection.

parameters.name: radius
parameters.description: (Default: 0, Maximum: 32000) Radius in meters for which all Parcel records will be returned if they are within the radius zone from latitude and longitude point.

parameters.name: offset_id
parameters.description: ID from a previous query exceeding the limit, returns the next set of results up to limit.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of Parcel Records to return.

parameters.name: return_geometry
parameters.description: Default true. A features are returned without geometry values.

parameters.name: return_count
parameters.description: Set to true to enable count of parcels in query.

parameters.name: return_custom
parameters.description: Default false: A true value allows county-specific fields to be passed through beyond standard schema fields only.

parameters.name: return_field_labels
parameters.description: Default false: A true value shows the naming convention for each standardized schema field.

parameters.name: return_stacked
parameters.description: Default true: A false value returns the first parcel if geometries are identical.

parameters.name: return_zoning
parameters.description: Set to false to disable zoning data in the response. Default is true when supported by the account.

parameters.name: return_matched_buildings
parameters.description: Set to false to disable building footprint data in the response. Default is true when supported by the account.

parameters.name: return_matched_addresses
parameters.description: Set to false to matched addresses data in the response. Default is true when supported by the account.

parameters.name: return_enhanced_ownership
parameters.description: Set to false to disable enhanced ownership data in the response. Default is true when supported by the account.

200.description: A list of parcel features. When supported by the account with buildings array and addresses property

This is equivalent to the coordinate reference system identified by the Open Geospatial Consortium (OGC) URN An OPTIONAL third-position element SHALL be the height in meters above or below the WGS 84 reference ellipsoid. In the absence of elevation values, applications sensitive to height or depth SHOULD interpret positions as being at local ground or sea level.

items.description:
A linear ring is a closed LineString with four or more positions.
The first and last positions are equivalent, and they MUST contain identical values; their representation SHOULD also be identical.
A linear ring is the boundary of a surface or the boundary of a hole in a surface.
A linear ring MUST follow the right-hand rule with respect to the area it bounds, i.e., exterior rings are counterclockwise, and holes are clockwise.

GeoJSon fundamental geometry construct.
A position is an array of numbers. There MUST be two or more elements. The first two elements are longitude and latitude, or easting and northing, precisely in that order and using decimal numbers. Altitude or elevation MAY be included as an optional third element.
Implementations SHOULD NOT extend positions beyond three elements because the semantics of extra elements are unspecified and ambiguous. Historically, some implementations have used a fourth element to carry a linear referencing measure (sometimes denoted as "M") or a numerical timestamp, but in most situations a parser will not be able to properly interpret these values. The interpretation and meaning of additional elements is beyond the scope of this specification, and additional elements MAY be ignored by parsers.

ed_str_uuid.description: Universally Unique ID of the entire structure

ed_bld_uuid.description: Universal Unique ID of the building extracted from the structure

ed_lat.description: Latitude of a point in the shape, typically the centroid

ed_lon.description: Longitude of a point in the shape, typically the centroid

ed_bldg_footprint_sqft.description: Building footprint area in square feet

ed_largest.description: An indicator of the largest building on a parcel

ed_source_date.description: Date of the building source imagery formatted as MM/DD/YYYY

ed_mean_height.description: Mean height of the structure in feet. Available with Matched Building Footprints with Height Addon.

ed_max_object_height.description: Maximum height of the structure in ft, excluding potential clutter like an antenna, overhanging tree, etc.. Available with Matched Building Footprints with Height Addon.

ed_lag.description: Lowest Adjacent Grade - lowest observed ground elevation above sea level around the boundary of the building. Available with Matched Building Footprints with Height Addon.

ed_hag.description: Highest Adjacent Grade - highest observed ground elevation above sea level around the boundary of the building. Available with Matched Building Footprints with Height Addon.

ed_mean_elevation.description: Mean ground elevation in ft under the structure footprint. Available with Matched Building Footprints with Height Addon.

ed_mean_slope.description: Mean roof slope. Available with Matched Building Footprints with Height Addon.

ed_stories.description: Estimated number of stories based on building height. Available with Matched Building Footprints with Height Addon.

ed_gross_area.description: Estimated area of the building based on stories and square footage of the polygon. Available with Matched Building Footprints with Height Addon.

ed_volume.description: Volume of the building based on square footage and the mean height of the polygon in cubic feet. Available with Matched Building Footprints with Height Addon.

zoning.description: Zoning details are returned when supported by an account.

post.description: Search for parcels in a specific geographical area. This endpoint allows access to test all our premium matched datasets with applicable API token. Accepted formats vary from GeoJSON Feature Collection of geometries (Polygon, MultiPolygon, Point, MultiPoint, LineString and/or MultiLineString), or a Feature with a GeoJSON geometry or a direct GeoJSON geometry. These parameters also accept an optional radius parameter in meters to create a buffer around the given geometries. Note adding a radius can increase the overall area of the request reaching the area size limit per request.

requestBody.description:
* "The polygon's GeoJSON geometry (the area being searched). The polygon can not be larger than 80 sq miles."
* "Three geo coordinates to use: [ -96.77737790638413, 32.8277929786983], [-96.77476147447638, 32.82780540015257], [-96.77614360093615, 32.82905995805102]"

items.description: Array of lat/lon point pairs

parameters.name: radius
parameters.description: (Default: 0, Maximum: 32000) Radius in meters for which all Parcel records will be returned if they are within the radius zone from latitude and longitude point.

parameters.name: offset_id
parameters.description: ID from a previous query exceeding the limit, returns the next set of results up to limit.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of Parcel Records to return.

parameters.name: return_geometry
parameters.description: Default true. A features are returned without geometry values.

parameters.name: return_count
parameters.description: Set to true to enable count of parcels in query.

parameters.name: return_custom
parameters.description: Default false: A true value allows county-specific fields to be passed through beyond standard schema fields only.

parameters.name: return_field_labels
parameters.description: Default false: A true value shows the naming convention for each standardized schema field.

parameters.name: return_stacked
parameters.description: Default true: A false value returns the first parcel if geometries are identical.

parameters.name: return_zoning
parameters.description: Set to false to disable zoning data in the response. Default is true when supported by the account.

parameters.name: return_matched_buildings
parameters.description: Set to false to disable building footprint data in the response. Default is true when supported by the account.

parameters.name: return_matched_addresses
parameters.description: Set to false to matched addresses data in the response. Default is true when supported by the account.

parameters.name: return_enhanced_ownership
parameters.description: Set to false to disable enhanced ownership data in the response. Default is true when supported by the account.

200.description: A list of parcel features. When supported by the account with buildings array and addresses property

headline.description: A human-friendly display address for the parcel. If no address is available, it falls back to the parcel number.

fields.description: Standard Schema keys and values. Columns from the parcel table. These include standard column names wherever fields are available, plus additional columns varying by the particular county & data available.

field_labels.description: Human-friendly labels for each key in fields

context.description: A bit of info about the city or county where this parcel is found, including a path one can use as context for further searches.

addresses.description: Regrid Matched Addresses. This array is included in responses when an account has Matched Addresses enabled.

buildings.description: Matched buildings are returned when supported by an account.

get.description: This endpoint delivers a single parcel record based on the unique path. This is best used in combination with the  Typeahead API endpoint. This endpoint allows access to test all of our premium matched datasets with applicable API token.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The canonical path of the parcel in the Regrid system.

parameters.name: return_custom
parameters.description: Default false: A true value allows county-specific fields to be passed through beyond standard schema fields only.

parameters.name: return_field_labels
parameters.description: Default false: A true value shows the naming convention for each standardized schema field.

parameters.name: return_stacked
parameters.description: Default true: A false value returns the first parcel if geometries are identical.

parameters.name: return_zoning
parameters.description: Set to false to disable zoning data in the response. Default is true when supported by the account.

parameters.name: return_matched_buildings
parameters.description: Set to false to disable building footprint data in the response. Default is true when supported by the account.

parameters.name: return_matched_addresses
parameters.description: Set to false to matched addresses data in the response. Default is true when supported by the account.

parameters.name: return_enhanced_ownership
parameters.description: Set to false to disable enhanced ownership data in the response. Default is true when supported by the account.

200.description: A list of parcel features. When supported by the account with buildings array and addresses property

A linear ring is a closed LineString with four or more positions.
The first and last positions are equivalent, and they MUST contain identical values; their representation SHOULD also be identical.
A linear ring is the boundary of a surface or the boundary of a hole in a surface.
A linear ring MUST follow the right-hand rule with respect to the area it bounds, i.e., exterior rings are counterclockwise, and holes are clockwise.

GeoJSon fundamental geometry construct.
A position is an array of numbers. There MUST be two or more elements. The first two elements are longitude and latitude, or easting and northing, precisely in that order and using decimal numbers. Altitude or elevation MAY be included as an optional third element.
Implementations SHOULD NOT extend positions beyond three elements because the semantics of extra elements are unspecified and ambiguous. Historically, some implementations have used a fourth element to carry a linear referencing measure (sometimes denoted as "M") or a numerical timestamp, but in most situations a parser will not be able to properly interpret these values. The interpretation and meaning of additional elements is beyond the scope of this specification, and additional elements MAY be ignored by parsers.

headline.description: A human-friendly display address for the parcel. If no address is available, it falls back to the parcel number.

fields.description: Standard Schema keys and values. Columns from the parcel table. These include standard column names wherever fields are available, plus additional columns varying by the particular county & data available.

field_labels.description: Human-friendly labels for each key in fields

context.description: A bit of info about the city or county where this parcel is found, including a path one can use as context for further searches.

addresses.description: Regrid Matched Addresses. This array is included in responses when an account has Matched Addresses enabled.

buildings.description: Matched buildings are returned when supported by an account.

allOf.description: Abstract type for all GeoJSon 'Geometry' object the type of which is not 'GeometryCollection'
Abstract type for all GeoJSon object except Feature and FeatureCollection

GeoJSon object
The coordinate reference system for all GeoJSON coordinates is a geographic coordinate reference system, using the World Geodetic System 1984 (WGS 84) datum, with longitude and latitude units of decimal degrees. This is equivalent to the coordinate reference system identified by the Open Geospatial Consortium (OGC) URN An OPTIONAL third-position element SHALL be the height in meters above or below the WGS 84 reference ellipsoid. In the absence of elevation values, applications sensitive to height or depth SHOULD interpret positions as being at local ground or sea level.

ed_str_uuid.description: Universally Unique ID of the entire structure

ed_bld_uuid.description: Universal Unique ID of the building extracted from the structure

ed_lat.description: Latitude of a point in the shape, typically the centroid

ed_lon.description: Longitude of a point in the shape, typically the centroid

ed_bldg_footprint_sqft.description: Building footprint area in square feet

ed_largest.description: An indicator of the largest building on a parcel

ed_source_date.description: Date of the building source imagery formatted as MM/DD/YYYY

ed_mean_height.description: Mean height of the structure in feet. Available with Matched Building Footprints with Height Addon.

ed_max_object_height.description: Maximum height of the structure in ft, excluding potential clutter like an antenna, overhanging tree, etc.. Available with Matched Building Footprints with Height Addon.

ed_lag.description: Lowest Adjacent Grade - lowest observed ground elevation above sea level around the boundary of the building. Available with Matched Building Footprints with Height Addon.

ed_hag.description: Highest Adjacent Grade - highest observed ground elevation above sea level around the boundary of the building. Available with Matched Building Footprints with Height Addon.

ed_mean_elevation.description: Mean ground elevation in ft under the structure footprint. Available with Matched Building Footprints with Height Addon.

ed_mean_slope.description: Mean roof slope. Available with Matched Building Footprints with Height Addon.

ed_stories.description: Estimated number of stories based on building height. Available with Matched Building Footprints with Height Addon.

ed_gross_area.description: Estimated area of the building based on stories and square footage of the polygon. Available with Matched Building Footprints with Height Addon.

ed_volume.description: Volume of the building based on square footage and the mean height of the polygon in cubic feet. Available with Matched Building Footprints with Height Addon.

zoning.description: Zoning details are returned when supported by an account.

get.description: This endpoint delivers a single parcel record based on the Regrid id (ll_uuid).

parameters.name: ll_uuid
parameters.description: The UUID retrieved from another Regrid API call

parameters.name: return_custom
parameters.description: Default false: A true value allows county-specific fields to be passed through beyond standard schema fields only.

parameters.name: return_field_labels
parameters.description: Default false: A true value shows the naming convention for each standardized schema field.

parameters.name: return_stacked
parameters.description: Default true: A false value returns the first parcel if geometries are identical.

parameters.name: return_zoning
parameters.description: Set to false to disable zoning data in the response. Default is true when supported by the account.

parameters.name: return_matched_buildings
parameters.description: Set to false to disable building footprint data in the response. Default is true when supported by the account.

parameters.name: return_matched_addresses
parameters.description: Set to false to matched addresses data in the response. Default is true when supported by the account.

parameters.name: return_enhanced_ownership
parameters.description: Set to false to disable enhanced ownership data in the response. Default is true when supported by the account.

200.description: A list of parcel features. When supported by the account with buildings array and addresses property

get.description:
If a client-facing web page is making requests directly to our service, it will need an access token. To avoid exposing your main account's token to the public, we recommend using temporary client tokens. The process looks like this:
- When generating page content, your server asks the Regrid API for a temporary client token limited to typeahead calls (details below). You can create as many of these as desired, for free.
- The javascript autocomplete widget uses this token to call Typeahead API
- If it's invalid or expired, the request will return an HTTP code 400. You may wish to refresh the page to regenerate the client token

parameters.name: token
parameters.description: The main (secret) access token on your account.

parameters.name: exp
parameters.description: (optional): Expiration time in seconds. For example, `exp=14400` would generate a 4-hour token. The default is 24 hours (86400 seconds).

200.description: sucessful response

token.description: This is the client-side access token that can be used for typeahead requests.

expires_at.description: A unix timestamp for the time after which this token is no longer valid.

get.description: This endpoint retrieves the current Regrid Parcel Schema. You can use 'premium_only' to retrieve the schema listed for only premium fields.

parameters.name: premium_only
parameters.description: Default returns all. Set to True to returns schema for only premium fields and False to return only Standard

200.description: A list of current Regrid attributes

get.description: This endpoint retrieves the current Regrid Matched Building Footprints schema.

200.description: A list of current Regrid building attributes

get.description: This endpoints retrieves the current Regrid Matched Secondary Addresses

200.description: A list of current Regrid address attributes

get.description: This endpoint retrieves the current Regrid Enhanced Ownership Schema.

200.description: A list of current Regrid enhanced ownership attributes

get.description: This endpoint retrieves the current Regrid Standardized Zoning Schema.

200.description: A list of current Regrid standardized zoning attributes

get.description: This endpoint retrieves all records from our verse schema. These records are counties in the United States and Puerto Rico that tell the last time we did a full data pull from the source.

parameters.name: return_geometry
parameters.description: Default true. A features are returned without geometry values.

200.description: A list of current Regrid attributes

get.description: Check your current API usage stats to see how many requests, parcel records, and tiles have been used. You can see full history with using the parameter 'return_full_history' or specify a specific date range.

parameters.name: return_full_history
parameters.description: Set to true if you would like the entire API usage history.

parameters.name: begin_date
parameters.description: optional, datatype:date, YYYY/MM/DD returns the usage from the specified beginning date to current date unless 'end_date' is used.

parameters.name: end_date
parameters.description: optional, datatype: date, YYYY/MM/DD returns the usage for all usage up until the specified ending date unless 'begin_date' is used and when.

parameters.name: return_by_token
parameters.description: optional, returns usage by all available tokens. See `by_token` array in response of each token's usage data.

parameters.name: return_by_this_token
parameters.description: optional, returns usage for only this token.

200.description: OK Usage response body

post.description: You can report issues with specific parcels or general areas to us using this report endpoint. Reports help us prioritize updates. However, we cannot apply data received to this endpoint directly to our parcel data or respond individually to specific reports.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: optional, A path to a specific parcel or place

parameters.name: ll_uuid
parameters.description: optional, A 'll_uuid' to a specific parcel or place

parameters.name: comment
parameters.description: String describing the issue

parameters.name: details
parameters.description: details on specific fields

200.description: Successful Response

get.description: This endpoint retrieves the current Standardized Canada Schema.

200.description: A list of current Regrid standardized canada attributes.

get.description: This endpoint delivers parcels using latitude and longitude points. You can add a radius zone to the point or points and limit the amount of parcels returned in the response. Parameter 'geojson' takes priority if Lat/Lon is used in same request. This endpoint allows access to test all of our premium matched datasets. **Attention API Trial Token Users:** Data is restricted to 7 counties. Please only use data from one of the restricted counties.

parameters.name: lon
parameters.description: Longitude point

parameters.name: lat
parameters.description: Latitude point

parameters.name: radius
parameters.description: (Default: 0, Maximum: 32000) Radius in meters for which all Parcel records will be returned if they are within the radius zone from latitude and longitude point.

parameters.name: geojson
parameters.description: Geographic data structure for Point and MultiPoint only. This parameter takes priority if Lat/Lon is used in same request

parameters.name: offset_id
parameters.description: ID from a previous query exceeding the limit, returns the next set of results up to limit.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of Parcel Records to return.

parameters.name: return_count
parameters.description: Set to true to enable count of parcels in query.

parameters.name: return_geometry
parameters.description: Default true. A features are returned without geometry values.

parameters.name: return_custom
parameters.description: Default false: A true value allows county-specific fields to be passed through beyond standard schema fields only.

parameters.name: return_field_labels
parameters.description: Default false: A true value shows the naming convention for each standardized schema field.

parameters.name: return_stacked

allOf.description: Abstract type for all GeoJSon 'Geometry' object the type of which is not 'GeometryCollection'
Abstract type for all GeoJSon object except Feature and FeatureCollection

GeoJSon object
The coordinate reference system for all GeoJSON coordinates is a geographic coordinate reference system, using the World Geodetic System 1984 (WGS 84) datum, with longitude and latitude units of decimal degrees. This is equivalent to the coordinate reference system identified by the Open Geospatial Consortium (OGC) URN An OPTIONAL third-position element SHALL be the height in meters above or below the WGS 84 reference ellipsoid. In the absence of elevation values, applications sensitive to height or depth SHOULD interpret positions as being at local ground or sea level.

items.description:
A linear ring is a closed LineString with four or more positions.
The first and last positions are equivalent, and they MUST contain identical values; their representation SHOULD also be identical.
A linear ring is the boundary of a surface or the boundary of a hole in a surface.
A linear ring MUST follow the right-hand rule with respect to the area it bounds, i.e., exterior rings are counterclockwise, and holes are clockwise.

GeoJSon fundamental geometry construct.
A position is an array of numbers. There MUST be two or more elements. The first two elements are longitude and latitude, or easting and northing, precisely in that order and using decimal numbers. Altitude or elevation MAY be included as an optional third element.
Implementations SHOULD NOT extend positions beyond three elements because the semantics of extra elements are unspecified and ambiguous. Historically, some implementations have used a fourth element to carry a linear referencing measure (sometimes denoted as "M") or a numerical timestamp, but in most situations a parser will not be able to properly interpret these values. The interpretation and meaning of additional elements is beyond the scope of this specification, and additional elements MAY be ignored by parsers.

get.description: Search for parcels in a specific geographical area. This endpoint allows access to test all our premium matched datasets with applicable API token. Accepted formats vary from GeoJSON Feature Collection of geometries (Polygon, MultiPolygon, Point, MultiPoint, LineString and/or MultiLineString), or a Feature with a GeoJSON geometry or a direct GeoJSON geometry. Parameter 'geojson' takes priority if Lat/Long used in same request. These parameters also accept an optional radius parameter in meters to create a buffer around the given geometries. Note adding a radius can increase the overall area of the request reaching the area size limit per request.

parameters.name: geojson
parameters.description: A GeoJSON object with at least one geometry to filter results. The geometries can be no larger than 80 sq miles. Accepted GeoJSON formats are: FeatureCollection, Feature or geometry. Supported geometries: Polygon, MultiPolygon, Point, MultiPoint, LineString and MultiLineString. Variations of geometry types are allowed in a FeatureCollection.

parameters.name: radius
parameters.description: (Default: 0, Maximum: 32000) Radius in meters for which all Parcel records will be returned if they are within the radius zone from latitude and longitude point.

parameters.name: offset_id
parameters.description: ID from a previous query exceeding the limit, returns the next set of results up to limit.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of Parcel Records to return.

parameters.name: return_geometry
parameters.description: Default true. A features are returned without geometry values.

parameters.name: return_count
parameters.description: Set to true to enable count of parcels in query.

parameters.name: return_custom
parameters.description: Default false: A true value allows county-specific fields to be passed through beyond standard schema fields only.

parameters.name: return_field_labels
parameters.description: Default false: A true value shows the naming convention for each standardized schema field.

parameters.name: return_stacked
parameters.description: Default true: A false value returns the first parcel if geometries are identical.

200.description: A list of parcel features

The coordinate reference system for all GeoJSON coordinates is a geographic coordinate reference system, using the World Geodetic System 1984 (WGS 84) datum, with longitude and latitude units of decimal degrees. This is equivalent to the coordinate reference system identified by the Open Geospatial Consortium (OGC) URN An OPTIONAL third-position element SHALL be the height in meters above or below the WGS 84 reference ellipsoid. In the absence of elevation values, applications sensitive to height or depth SHOULD interpret positions as being at local ground or sea level.

items.description:
A linear ring is a closed LineString with four or more positions.
The first and last positions are equivalent, and they MUST contain identical values; their representation SHOULD also be identical.
A linear ring is the boundary of a surface or the boundary of a hole in a surface.
A linear ring MUST follow the right-hand rule with respect to the area it bounds, i.e., exterior rings are counterclockwise, and holes are clockwise.

GeoJSon fundamental geometry construct.
A position is an array of numbers. There MUST be two or more elements. The first two elements are longitude and latitude, or easting and northing, precisely in that order and using decimal numbers. Altitude or elevation MAY be included as an optional third element.
Implementations SHOULD NOT extend positions beyond three elements because the semantics of extra elements are unspecified and ambiguous. Historically, some implementations have used a fourth element to carry a linear referencing measure (sometimes denoted as "M") or a numerical timestamp, but in most situations a parser will not be able to properly interpret these values. The interpretation and meaning of additional elements is beyond the scope of this specification, and additional elements MAY be ignored by parsers.

headline.description: A human-friendly display address for the parcel. If no address is available, it falls back to the parcel number.

fields.description: Standard Schema keys and values. Columns from the parcel table. These include standard column names wherever fields are available, plus additional columns varying by the particular county & data available.

field_labels.description: Human-friendly labels for each key in fields

context.description: A bit of info about the city or county where this parcel is found, including a path one can use as context for further searches.

get.description: The Regrid API offers a flexible and dynamic set of features for querying Regrid Parcels by numerous fields, operators, geometries and allows for simple composition of API calls, from the output of one endpoint, to the input of another. Multiple fields can be used in a single query (up to 4), to refine results. [See full list of fields](https://support.regrid.com/api/international-api). Check out Sample Use Case Scenarios in this section

parameters.name: fields[:field_name][:operator]
parameters.description: Use a supported field name and operator, and value to perform a query.

parameters.name: geojson
parameters.description: A GeoJSON object with at least one geometry to filter results. The geometries can be no larger than 80 sq miles. If both `geojson` and `lat`-`lon` are present, `geojson` takes precedence. Accepted GeoJSON formats are: FeatureCollection, Feature or geometry. Supported geometries: Polygon, MultiPolygon, Point, MultiPoint, LineString and MultiLineString. Variations of geometry types are allowed in a FeatureCollection.

parameters.name: offset_id
parameters.description: ID from a previous query exceeding the limit, returns the next set of results up to limit.

parameters.name: radius
parameters.description: (Default: 0, Maximum: 32000) Radius in meters for which all Parcel records will be returned if they are within the radius zone from latitude and longitude point.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of Parcel Records to return.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: Represents the path for the /admin0/admin1/admin2. This restricts the search to this area.

parameters.name: return_count
parameters.description: Set to true to enable count of parcels in query.

parameters.name: return_geometry
parameters.description: Default true. A features are returned without geometry values.

parameters.name: return_custom
parameters.description: Default false: A true value allows county-specific fields to be passed through beyond standard schema fields only.

parameters.name: return_field_labels
parameters.description: Default false: A true value shows the naming convention for each standardized schema field.

parameters.name: return_stacked
parameters.description: Default true: A false value returns the first parcel if geometries are identical.

200.description: A list of parcel features.

get.description: Check your current API usage stats to see how many requests, parcel records, and tiles have been used. You can see full history with using the parameter 'return_full_history' or specify a specific date range.

parameters.name: return_full_history
parameters.description: Set to true if you would like the entire API usage history.

parameters.name: begin_date
parameters.description: optional, datatype:date, YYYY/MM/DD returns the usage from the specified beginning date to current date unless 'end_date' is used.

parameters.name: end_date
parameters.description: optional, datatype: date, YYYY/MM/DD returns the usage for all usage up until the specified ending date unless 'begin_date' is used and when.

parameters.name: return_by_token
parameters.description: optional, returns usage by all available tokens. See `by_token` array in response of each token's usage data.

parameters.name: return_by_this_token
parameters.description: optional, returns usage for only this token.

200.description: OK Usage response body

ed_str_uuid.description: Universally Unique ID of the entire structure

ed_bld_uuid.description: Universal Unique ID of the building extracted from the structure

ed_lat.description: Latitude of a point in the shape, typically the centroid

ed_lon.description: Longitude of a point in the shape, typically the centroid

ed_bldg_footprint_sqft.description: Building footprint area in square feet

ed_largest.description: An indicator of the largest building on a parcel

ed_source_date.description: Date of the building source imagery formatted as MM/DD/YYYY

ed_mean_height.description: Mean height of the structure in feet. Available with Matched Building Footprints with Height Addon.

ed_max_object_height.description: Maximum height of the structure in ft, excluding potential clutter like an antenna, overhanging tree, etc.. Available with Matched Building Footprints with Height Addon.

ed_lag.description: Lowest Adjacent Grade - lowest observed ground elevation above sea level around the boundary of the building. Available with Matched Building Footprints with Height Addon.

ed_hag.description: Highest Adjacent Grade - highest observed ground elevation above sea level around the boundary of the building. Available with Matched Building Footprints with Height Addon.

ed_mean_elevation.description: Mean ground elevation in ft under the structure footprint. Available with Matched Building Footprints with Height Addon.

ed_mean_slope.description: Mean roof slope. Available with Matched Building Footprints with Height Addon.

ed_stories.description: Estimated number of stories based on building height. Available with Matched Building Footprints with Height Addon.

ed_gross_area.description: Estimated area of the building based on stories and square footage of the polygon. Available with Matched Building Footprints with Height Addon.

ed_volume.description: Volume of the building based on square footage and the mean height of the polygon in cubic feet. Available with Matched Building Footprints with Height Addon.

zoning.description: Zoning details are returned when supported by an account.

allOf.description: Abstract type for all GeoJSon 'Geometry' object the type of which is not 'GeometryCollection'
Abstract type for all GeoJSon object except Feature and FeatureCollection

GeoJSon object
The coordinate reference system for all GeoJSON coordinates is a geographic coordinate reference system, using the World Geodetic System 1984 (WGS 84) datum, with longitude and latitude units of decimal degrees. This is equivalent to the coordinate reference system identified by the Open Geospatial Consortium (OGC) URN An OPTIONAL third-position element SHALL be the height in meters above or below the WGS 84 reference ellipsoid. In the absence of elevation values, applications sensitive to height or depth SHOULD interpret positions as being at local ground or sea level.

items.description:
A linear ring is a closed LineString with four or more positions.
The first and last positions are equivalent, and they MUST contain identical values; their representation SHOULD also be identical.
A linear ring is the boundary of a surface or the boundary of a hole in a surface.
A linear ring MUST follow the right-hand rule with respect to the area it bounds, i.e., exterior rings are counterclockwise, and holes are clockwise.

GeoJSon fundamental geometry construct.
A position is an array of numbers. There MUST be two or more elements. The first two elements are longitude and latitude, or easting and northing, precisely in that order and using decimal numbers. Altitude or elevation MAY be included as an optional third element.
Implementations SHOULD NOT extend positions beyond three elements because the semantics of extra elements are unspecified and ambiguous. Historically, some implementations have used a fourth element to carry a linear referencing measure (sometimes denoted as "M") or a numerical timestamp, but in most situations a parser will not be able to properly interpret these values. The interpretation and meaning of additional elements is beyond the scope of this specification, and additional elements MAY be ignored by parsers.

headline.description: A human-friendly display address for the parcel. If no address is available, it falls back to the parcel number.

fields.description: Standard Schema keys and values. Columns from the parcel table. These include standard column names wherever fields are available, plus additional columns varying by the particular county & data available.

field_labels.description: Human-friendly labels for each key in fields

context.description: A bit of info about the city or county where this parcel is found, including a path one can use as context for further searches.

ed_str_uuid.description: Universally Unique ID of the entire structure

ed_bld_uuid.description: Universal Unique ID of the building extracted from the structure

ed_lat.description: Latitude of a point in the shape, typically the centroid

ed_lon.description: Longitude of a point in the shape, typically the centroid

ed_bldg_footprint_sqft.description: Building footprint area in square feet

ed_largest.description: An indicator of the largest building on a parcel

ed_source_date.description: Date of the building source imagery formatted as MM/DD/YYYY

ed_mean_height.description: Mean height of the structure in feet. Available with Matched Building Footprints with Height Addon.

ed_max_object_height.description: Maximum height of the structure in ft, excluding potential clutter like an antenna, overhanging tree, etc.. Available with Matched Building Footprints with Height Addon.

ed_lag.description: Lowest Adjacent Grade - lowest observed ground elevation above sea level around the boundary of the building. Available with Matched Building Footprints with Height Addon.

ed_hag.description: Highest Adjacent Grade - highest observed ground elevation above sea level around the boundary of the building. Available with Matched Building Footprints with Height Addon.

ed_mean_elevation.description: Mean ground elevation in ft under the structure footprint. Available with Matched Building Footprints with Height Addon.

ed_mean_slope.description: Mean roof slope. Available with Matched Building Footprints with Height Addon.

ed_stories.description: Estimated number of stories based on building height. Available with Matched Building Footprints with Height Addon.

ed_gross_area.description: Estimated area of the building based on stories and square footage of the polygon. Available with Matched Building Footprints with Height Addon.

ed_volume.description: Volume of the building based on square footage and the mean height of the polygon in cubic feet. Available with Matched Building Footprints with Height Addon.

Position.description:
GeoJSon fundamental geometry construct.
A position is an array of numbers. There MUST be two or more elements. The first two elements are longitude and latitude, or easting and northing, precisely in that order and using decimal numbers. Altitude or elevation MAY be included as an optional third element.
Implementations SHOULD NOT extend positions beyond three elements because the semantics of extra elements are unspecified and ambiguous. Historically, some implementations have used a fourth element to carry a linear referencing measure (sometimes denoted as "M") or a numerical timestamp, but in most situations a parser will not be able to properly interpret these values. The interpretation and meaning of additional elements is beyond the scope of this specification, and additional elements MAY be ignored by parsers.

The interpretation and meaning of additional elements is beyond the scope of this specification, and additional elements MAY be ignored by parsers.
